snippet: The insurer failed to protect data in its computers through encryption in the same way it protected medical information, and 80 million records were accessed.
abstract: Hacker attack on health insurer Anthem reveals vulnerability of health care firms, which are thought to be lagging behind other industries in protecting sensitive customer data; Anthem failed to protect its computers in same way it guarded medical information that was outside its database; hackers reached up to 80 million records.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: The insurer failed to protect data in its computers through encryption in the same way it protected medical information, and 80 million records were accessed.

headline.main: Anthem Hacking Points to Security Vulnerability of Health Care Industry
